meanings.definition: Of or relating to a typical example or pattern
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a paradigmatic example to explain the concept to the students.
meanings.sent2: Her behavior was paradigmatic of a good leader.
meanings.sent3: It was paradigmatic how the cat always greeted its owner at the door.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted a paradigmatic picture in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The bright smile on her face was paradigmatic of her happiness.

meanings.definition: Serving as a model or example
meanings.sent1: The new car model was paradigmatic of modern design trends.
meanings.sent2: His success story is paradigmatic of hard work paying off.
meanings.sent3: It was paradigmatic how the puppy learned to fetch so quickly.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood paradigmatic in the forest, symbolizing strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The recipe she shared was paradigmatic for delicious chocolate chip cookies.

meanings.definition: Exemplifying a set of linguistic forms or constructions
meanings.sent1: The sentence structure in the textbook was paradigmatic of proper grammar rules.
meanings.sent2: His speech was paradigmatic of formal language use.
meanings.sent3: It was paradigmatic how the words flowed effortlessly in her poem.
meanings.sent4: The dialogue in the play was paradigmatic, showcasing different speech patterns.
meanings.sent5: The language used in the scientific report was paradigmatic, making it easy to understand.
